archimate:BusinessEvent.name: ADV019 Phishing
archimate:BusinessEvent.documentation:
The threat counterfeits communications from a legitimate/trustworthy source to mislead recipients into revealing sensitive information such as usernames, passwords or personally identifiable information (PII).
Assessment guidance: At lower levels of threat strength the threat is likely to use relatively unsophisticated techniques, involving: ԉ the use of generic, publicly available phishing tools ԉ basic delivery mechanisms (e.g. spam emails) ԉ targeting a large number of individuals or organisations indiscriminately.
At higher levels of threat strength the threat could employ more sophisticated techniques, involving: ԉ the use of customised phishing tools ԉ the use of more advanced delivery mechanisms (e.g. counterfeit websites with forged TLS certificates) ԉ ‘spear phishing’, or targeting specific individuals (e.g. executives or individuals with privileged access).
